intro: Microseris astrata, commonly known as the starry microseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The species is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped yellow flowers and basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Microseris astrata is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate, thriving in full sun and well-drained soil.
